snippet: Raising questions about the efficacy of anti-discrimination programs.
abstract: Raising questions about the efficacy of anti-discrimination programs.
lead_paragraph: “Differences between how the world’s two largest democracies have chosen to redress centuries of past discrimination are striking,” Gardiner Harris wrote in The New York Times, citing the cases of two women, one from India and the other from the United States, both of whom were denied “coveted spots at elite universities.”

headline.main: India’s Rich Benefit From Schools’ Affirmative Action
